page.title: 01THE KING'S FOREST 1
page.content: The whole area is owned by the Forestry Commission and is managed from the Santon Downham Centre as part of the Thetford Forest. Information about the Centre,the landscape and the ecology of the Forest can be found under 0580 0285. The area is bisected by the only public road, the B1106. There is a beautiful stretch where old beech trees line the road and here the F.C. have made a picnic site with a map which indicates various walks including the long-distance footpath. Part of the Icknield Way passes through the west side from the extreme S.W.corner in a N.N.E. direction.The King's Forest is so named because it was planted in 1935 for King George V's Silver Jubilee. See also 0580 0276.
